paragraphs.body: The Spirit World is a parallel plane of reality that coexists alongside the ${link_0} inhabited by humans. It is home to the spirits, a vast range of immortal, supernatural entities that often embody different aspects of life and nature.
paragraphs.text: The Spirit World is a parallel plane of reality that coexists alongside the physical world inhabited by humans. It is home to the spirits, a vast range of immortal, supernatural entities that often embody different aspects of life and nature.

paragraphs.body: In 171 AG, Avatar ${link_0} was tricked and forced into opening the Southern and Northern spirit portals but eventually decided to leave them open, reasoning that humans and spirits were meant to live harmoniously together. In 174 AG, a third spirit portal was accidentally created by an overloaded discharge of energy from the ${link_1}. paragraphs.text: In 171 AG, Avatar Korra was tricked and forced into opening the Southern and Northern spirit portals but eventually decided to leave them open, reasoning that humans and spirits were meant to live harmoniously together. In 174 AG, a third spirit portal was accidentally created by an overloaded discharge of energy from the spirit energy cannon. Its location in the heart of Republic City put the already unsteady balance between humans and spirits in danger; some humans feared the spirits, while others wanted to exploit them and the Spirit World by turning the portal into an amusement park from where they could organize tours and excursions into the Spirit World.

paragraphs.body: There are few known ways for humans other than the Avatar to enter into the Spirit World: Sometimes humans are carried there by a spirit as the entity shifts between the worlds. Enlightened individuals can cross over to the Spirit World through meditation, and others can enter physically through one of the three spirit portals. Individuals who cross over to the Spirit World cannot use their ${link_0}, unless they have entered physically through the spirit portals. Despite this, the Avatar is able to use ${link_1} when in the Spirit World, even when they did not enter through a portal, as they are connected to all the spiritual energy when in that world.

paragraphs.body: During the ${link_0}, the spirit portals at the ${link_1} and ${link_2} were the primary passages between the Spirit and physical worlds, and spirits could migrate freely between the two. After Avatar ${link_3} closed the spirit portals following the ${link_4} of 9,829 BG, travel between the two worlds became extremely restricted, only possible through a few specific locations and methods. As the bridge between the two worlds, the Avatar could cross over in spiritual form in order to converse with the spirits and ask them for guidance. After the opening of the Southern (and later the Northern) spirit portal, humans such as ${link_5} were able to physically enter the Spirit World once again, and brought with them "darkness and anger" that threatened to overtake the Spirit World. These negative emotions were amplified during the Harmonic Convergence of 171 AG, when ${link_6} used the increased spiritual energy of the event to break free from his prison inside the ${link_7}. After Vaatu was defeated, Avatar Korra decided to leave the spirit portals open, once again uniting the Spirit and the physical worlds.
paragraphs.text: During the Era of Raava, the spirit portals at the North and South Poles were the primary passages between the Spirit and physical worlds, and spirits could migrate freely between the two. After Avatar Wan closed the spirit portals following the Harmonic Convergence of 9,829 BG, travel between the two worlds became extremely restricted, only possible through a few specific locations and methods. As the bridge between the two worlds, the Avatar could cross over in spiritual form in order to converse with the spirits and ask them for guidance. After the opening of the Southern (and later the Northern) spirit portal, humans such as Unalaq were able to physically enter the Spirit World once again, and brought with them "darkness and anger" that threatened to overtake the Spirit World. These negative emotions were amplified during the Harmonic Convergence of 171 AG, when Vaatu used the increased spiritual energy of the event to break free from his prison inside the Tree of Time. After Vaatu was defeated, Avatar Korra decided to leave the spirit portals open, once again uniting the Spirit and the physical worlds.

paragraphs.body: In 174 AG, a third spirit portal was created by accident when the ${link_0}'s spirit energy cannon overloaded and released an enormous discharge of spiritual energy. Korra attempted to control of the force of the explosion with energybending, and this tore open a new portal between the physical and Spirit Worlds. After the conclusion of the ${link_1}, Korra and ${link_2} used this portal to cross over to the Spirit World, where they traveled around for several days as a vacation. When they returned, however, they discovered that ${link_3}, the owner of the land surrounding the spirit portal, intended to turn the area into an amusement park and organize excursions into the Spirit World. paragraphs.text: In 174 AG, a third spirit portal was created by accident when the Earth Empire's spirit energy cannon overloaded and released an enormous discharge of spiritual energy. Korra attempted to control of the force of the explosion with energybending, and this tore open a new portal between the physical and Spirit Worlds. After the conclusion of the invasion of the United Republic of Nations, Korra and Asami used this portal to cross over to the Spirit World, where they traveled around for several days as a vacation. When they returned, however, they discovered that Wonyong Keum, the owner of the land surrounding the spirit portal, intended to turn the area into an amusement park and organize excursions into the Spirit World. Several spirits rebelled against this idea, with the dragon eel spirit even imploring Korra to close the spirit portals again, as it left the Spirit World vulnerable to be ravaged and exploited by humans.

paragraphs.body: The lair of the spirit ${link_0}, the Face Stealer, lies below a gigantic, twisted tree. The land surrounding his covert is barren, dark, and scarcely inhabited, except for Koh's faceless victims and at least one gargantuan wolf. For anyone who enters his lair it is advisable to remain emotionless, as Koh steals the face of anyone who expresses their emotions in front of him.

paragraphs.body: The Fog of Lost Souls is a prison for humans in the Spirit World. The fog spirit that is the prison has the ability to drive humans into madness, trapping them within their own darkest memory and subsequently prohibiting them from escaping. After ${link_0} was pulled to the Spirit World by ${link_1}, his soul became trapped in the fog, where he continued his self-praising monologue about being a conqueror and a ${link_2}-slayer. In 171 AG, ${link_3} trapped ${link_4} in the fog, and ${link_5}, ${link_6}, and ${link_7} also later became imprisoned there after setting out to rescue the young airbender. After Tenzin overcame his insecurity about his identity, the fog momentarily cleared and he was able to rescue his family. Sometime later, ${link_8} also threw ${link_9}'s soul inside the prison, condemning him to wander the fog for eternity.

paragraphs.body: Xai Bau's Grove is located deep in the Spirit World in a canyon densely populated by trees. paragraphs.body: The Spirit Oasis is a verdant oasis located in the Northern Water Tribe at the base of a waterfall behind the ${link_0}'s ${link_1}. It is the center of all the spiritual energy in the entire North Pole and, unlike the rest of the region, has a warmer climate able to facilitate the growth of vegetation. Two koi fish swim in a central pool of the oasis and are the mortal forms of ${link_2} and ${link_3}, the Moon and the Ocean Spirits. Under normal circumstances, if one sets foot in the pool it acts normal. However, sometimes it can open as a portal to the Spirit World, and even be used to drag people nearby it to the Spirit World.

paragraphs.body: The entities of the Spirit World are affiliated with either light or darkness, usually depending on who, Raava or Vaatu respectively, won the last Harmonic Convergence. Most spirits resemble some aspect of nature and occasionally, humans can transcend the mortal realm after death and become spirits. A special relationship exists between the great light and dark spirits, as one cannot exist without the other, and even if one manages to defeat the other, their counterpart will always reemerge again over time.
